description.narrative: Our main activities will be focused on community engagement to identify user led innovations and sustainable local solutions to experiment on and scale up.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies 3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative: 1.1: 5new sources of data per year 1.2: 6 different type of data sources per year 1.3: 20 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4 : 5 innovation methods per Action Plan 2.1: 6 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 : At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3: At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. 3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network 48 interaction per year 3.2 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.4 The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts.

1.2: More than 6 different types of data were used during 3 learning action plans: User journeys, Socioeconomic data, Focus group, Unstructured data in textual format, Surveys, Mentorship, Primary data, issue mapping, Social network / social media data, Visual mapping, Open data 1.3 20 Solutions were identified and uploaded on global solutions mapping platform. 1.4 The following innovation methods were used in each action plan: Actions plan 1: Design Thinking, Hackathons, Minimal Viable Product (MVP), Pilots, Reverse Engineering, Behavioral insights Actions plan 2: Co-creation, Minimal Viable Product (MVP), Positive Deviance, Solutions Mapping, community asset mapping Actions plan 3: Sensemaking, System Thinking
2.1 : 6 blogs were published during 2021 with one co-led social media campaign. 2.2 in two of our learning challenges we collaborated with different public and non-profit entities. 2.3 Agricultural advisory unit in coastal area used one of the finding during our second challenge (Liquid composting). 2.4 2 projects are now being scaled up within our country offices: Frugal entrepreneurship, revers shop
3.1 we are interacting on weekly bases with other colleagues in the Accelerator labs using: Teams, WhatsApp groups, weekly group calls. 3.2: Regular update, information, new methodologies used is being shared across the network should. 3.4 Although not on a monthly basis, The Accelerator Lab Syria has been featured at UNDP Syria social media platforms under the hashtag #AcceleratorlabSyria. The names of the social media profiles on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and twitters are UNDP Syria, UNDP Arab state
Accelerator lab team started working on 10th of Oct 2020.

1.1: 5new sources of data per year 1.2: 6 different type of data sources per year 1.3: 30 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4 : 5 innovation methods per Action Plan 2.1: 6 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 : At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3: At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. 3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network 48 interaction per year 3.2 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.4 The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts.
